The time between episodes can vary considerably from weeks to years. Fevers are often associated with other symptoms, which may include muscle, joint, and/or abdominal pain; a spreading rash; puffiness and/or swelling around the eyes; and/or inflammation in various other areas of the body including the heart muscle, joints, throat, or mucous membranes.
